meanings.definition: To strike with a heavy, crushing blow.
meanings.sent1: He was bashing the nail into the wood.
meanings.sent2: The boxer was bashing his opponent with powerful punches.
meanings.sent3: The chef was bashing the garlic to release its flavor.
meanings.sent4: The storm was bashing against the windows all night long.
meanings.sent5: The drummer was bashing the drums with great enthusiasm.

meanings.sent1: The movie critic was bashing the new film for its poor acting.
meanings.sent2: The online trolls were bashing the celebrity for her outfit choice.
meanings.sent3: The teacher was bashing the students' sloppy work with red pen marks.
meanings.sent4: The politician was bashing his opponent's policies in the debate.
meanings.sent5: The journalist was bashing the company for their unethical practices.

meanings.sent1: The bashing of the waves against the shore was deafening.
meanings.sent2: The knight's shield protected him from the enemy's bashing.
meanings.sent3: The bashing of the drums echoed through the concert hall.
meanings.sent4: The sudden bashing on the door startled the family.
meanings.sent5: The bashing of the hammer against the metal rang out in the workshop.
